page.title: 12Farming in Middleton
page.content:
There are 7 farmsteads and one former farmstead. Castle Farm is typical, a hill farm of 283 acres rising from 750ft to 1100ft on limestone. The land is mainly grass. There are 50 acres of sileage ( 20 acres mown twice ), 18 acres of Hay, 31 acres Barley used for own stock; the remainder pasture. The livestock is Beef, Sheep and three milk cows. The milk helps feed calves bought in for rearing. Cattle number 200, mainly bullocks. The sheep - 170 ewes, 60 ewe lamb replacements and 220 lambs for selling.
Sileage is harvested by contractors. Farm machinery consists of 3 tractors, hay-making and sileage feeding machines, manure spreader and front end loader. Two brothers aged 62 and 52 work Castle Farm with some casual labour.
